discussion: 1. Should the United States have federal net neutrality laws? Why or why not?
2. Do net neutrality regulations protect consumers? Explain your answer(s).
3. Do net neutrality regulations unfairly limit internet companies?
action: 1. ExploreKevin Taglang’sposition that the internet needs net neutrality protections.
2. Consider which states have enacted (or considered enacting) net neutrality legislation according to theNational Conference of State Legislatures.
3. AnalyzeKen Engelhart’sposition that net neutrality laws are not needed because the internet is “inherently neutral.”

4. Consider how you felt about the issue before reading this article. After reading the pros and cons on this topic, has your thinking changed? If so, how? List two to three ways. If your thoughts have not changed, list two to three ways your better understanding of the “other side of the issue” now helps you better argue your position.
5. Push for the position and policies you support by writing US nationalsenatorsandrepresentatives.
